==Applies To==
* Android applications that cache data.
==What to Do==
Do not cache sensitive data.
==Why==
Avoid caching sensitive data to prevent this data from falling into the wrong hands if the device is stolen or compromised.
==How==
To prevent caching of sensitive data:
# **Identify sensitive data.** Make a list of all sensitive information handled by your application. Some examples are: #* Passwords #* Encryption keys #* Personal information # **Identify code that creates temporary files used by the application.** Review the functions in the application source code that are responsible for creating the temporary files. Find any such functions that write sensitive data. # **Remove code that writes sensitive data to temporary files.** Edit the functions that write sensitive data to temporary files to prevent caching of sensitive data.
